0.name: Pit Trap
0.description: A pit trap is a large hole in the ground, usually covered by a thin layer of soil, leaves, or other debris. The pit is typically 10 to 20 feet deep and lined with sharp spikes or other dangerous objects. When a creature steps on the covering, it collapses, sending the creature plummeting into the pit.

1.name: Arrow Trap
1.description: An arrow trap is a hidden mechanism that fires a volley of arrows at anyone who triggers it. The arrows are usually poisoned or coated with some other harmful substance.

2.name: Swinging Blade Trap
2.description: A swinging blade trap is a large blade that swings down from the ceiling or up from the floor when triggered. The blade is usually razor-sharp and can cut through flesh and bone with ease.

3.name: Fire Trap
3.description: A fire trap is a hidden mechanism that releases a burst of flame when triggered. The flames are usually magical in nature and can burn for several rounds before extinguishing themselves.

4.name: Poison Gas Trap
4.description: A poison gas trap is a hidden mechanism that releases a cloud of poisonous gas when triggered. The gas is usually colorless and odorless, making it difficult to detect until it is too late.
